all_true.title: All lanes true
all_true.description: These functions return 1 if all lanes in `a` are non-zero, 0 otherwise.

any_true.title: Any bit true
any_true.description: These functions return 1 if any bit in `a` is non-zero, 0 otherwise.

bitmask.title: Bitmask extraction
bitmask.description: These operations extract the high bit for each lane in `a` and produce a scalar mask with all bits concatenated.

bitselect.title: Bitwise select
bitselect.description: Select bits from one of two input vectors according to the value of the corresponding bit in a third vector.

ceil.title: Ceiling
ceil.description: Lane-wise round toward positive infinity to nearest integer value.

const.title: Constant
const.description: Materialize a constant `v128` SIMD value from the 16 immediate bytes in the immediate mode operand `imm`. The `v128.const` instruction is encoded with 16 immediate bytes which provide the bits of the vector directly.

convert.title: Conversion to floating point
convert.description: Lane-wise round to nearest integer value with ties toward even.

demote_zero.title: Conversion from double to single-precison floating point.
demote_zero.description: Convert double-precision floating point values to single-precision floating point.  High lanes are zeroed.

dot.title: Integer dot product
dot.description: Lane-wise multiply signed 16-bit integers in the two input vectors and add adjacent pairs of the full 32-bit results.

eq.title: Equality
eq.description: Test each element for equality; the result is all zeros for false or all ones for true.

extadd_pairwise.title: Extended pairwise integer addition
extadd_pairwise.description: Lane-wise integer extended pairwise addition producing extended results (twice wider results than the inputs).

extend.title: Extend integers.
extend.description: Convert from narrower signed type to wider type.

extmul.title: Extended integer multiplication
extmul.description: Lane-wise integer extended multiplication producing twice wider result than the inputs.

extract_lane.title: Extract lane as a scalar
extract_lane.description:
Extract the scalar value of lane specified in the immediate mode operand `imm` in `a`. The `{interpretation}.extract_lane{_s}{_u}` instructions are encoded with one immediate byte providing the index of the lane to extract.
The _s and _u variants will sign-extend or zero-extend the lane value to i32 respectively.

floor.title: Floor
floor.description: Lane-wise round toward negative infinity to nearest integer value.

ge.title: Less than or equal
ge.description: Lane-wise greater than or equal to comparison of two vectors, storing all zeros in the return value if the result is false and all ones if it is true.

gt.title: Greater-than
gt.description: Lane-wise greater than comparison of two vectors, storing all zeros in the return value if the result is false and all ones if it is true.

le.title: Less than or equal
le.description: Lane-wise less than or equal to comparison of two vectors, storing all zeros in the return value if the result is false and all ones if it is true.

load.title: Load
load.description: Load a `v128` vector from the given heap address.

load_extend.title: Load and Extend
load_extend.description: Load 64-bits of integers and extend each element.

load_lane.title: Load Lane
load_lane.description: Load a single element from memory into the specified lane.

load_splat.title: Load and Splat
load_splat.description: Load a single element from memory into the all lanes of a vector.

load_zero.title: Load and Zero-Pad
load_zero.description: Load a single element into the low bits of a vector, zero the remaining bits.

lt.title: Less-than
lt.description: Lane-wise less than comparison of two vectors, storing all zeros in the return value if the result is false and all ones if it is true.

max.title: Lane-wise integer maximum
max.description: Compares lane-wise signed/unsigned integers, and returns the maximum of each pair.

min.title: Lane-wise minimum
min.description:
Compares values, and returns the minimum of each pair.
For floating-point values, if either value is NaN then the result is NaN.

narrow.title: Narrowing saturated conversion.
narrow.description: Convert from wider signed type to narrower type.

ne.title: Inequality
ne.description: Test each element for inequality; the result is all zeros for false or all ones for true.

nearest.title: Round to nearest
nearest.description: Lane-wise round to nearest integer value with ties toward even.

pmax.title: Lane-wise pseudo-maximum
pmax.description:
Compares values, and returns the maximum of each pair.
The operation is defined as `a < b ? b : a`.

pmin.title: Lane-wise pseudo-minimum
pmin.description:
Compares values, and returns the minimum of each pair.
The operation is defined as `b < a ? b : a`.

popcnt.title: Lane-wise Population Count
popcnt.description: Count the number of bits set to one within each lane.

promote_low.title: Conversion from single to double-precison floating point.
promote_low.description: Convert low single-precision floating point values to single-precision floating point.

q15mulr_sat.title: Saturating integer Q-format rounding multiplication
q15mulr_sat.description: Lane-wise saturating rounding multiplication in Q15 format.

replace_lane.title: Replace lane value
replace_lane.description:
Return a new vector with lanes identical to `a`, except for the lane specified in the immediate mode operand `imm` which has the value `x`. The `{interpretation}.replace_lane` instructions are encoded with an immediate byte providing the index of the lane the value of which is to be replaced.
The input lane value, x, is interpreted the same way as for the splat instructions. For the i8 and i16 lanes, the high bits of x are ignored.

shl.title: Left shift by scalar
shl.description: Shift the bits in each lane to the left by the same amount. The shift count is taken modulo lane width.

shr.title: Right shift by scalar
shr.description: Shift the bits in each lane to the right by the same amount. The shift count is taken modulo lane width. This is an arithmetic right shift for the `_s` variants and a logical right shift for the `_u` variants.

shuffle.title: Shuffling using immediate indices
shuffle.description:
Shuffle two vectors using the indices specified by the the immediate parameters.  Values in the range [0, 15] are selected from the first vector, and values in [16, 31] are selected from the second vector. Values outside of [0, 31] are invalid.
This basically works the same as clang's [`__builtin_shufflevector`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/LanguageExtensions.html#langext-builtin-shufflevector).

splat.title: Create vector with identical lanes
splat.description: Construct a vector with x replicated to all lanes.

store.title: Store
store.description: Store a vector to the specificed address.

store_lane.title: Store Lane
store_lane.description: Store a single lane from a vector to the specified address.

swizzle.title: Swizzling using variable indices
swizzle.description: Returns a new vector with lanes selected from the lanes of the first input vector `a` specified in the second input vector `s`. The indices `i` in range `[0, 15]` select the `i`-th element of `a`. For indices outside of the range the resulting lane is initialized to 0.

trunc.title: Truncate
trunc.description: Lane-wise round toward zero to nearest integer value.

trunc_sat.title: Saturated conversion from floating-point to integers
trunc_sat.description: Conversion from floating-point to integer types, with saturation. NaN is converted to 0.

trunc_sat_zero.title: Saturated conversion from double-precision floating-point to integers
trunc_sat_zero.description: Conversion double-precision floating-point to 32-bit integers, with saturation.  NaN is converted to 0.  High lanes in output vector are zeroed.
